summary: A U.S. Customs and Border Protection TECS Person Encounter List detailing numerous private flight entries for Jeffrey Epstein between December 2016 and December 2018. The document logs his arrivals and departures, primarily between airports in Florida, New York, the U.S. Virgin Islands, and international locations, using various aircraft tail numbers.

persons.name: Jeffrey Edward Epstein
persons.context: The sole individual listed in this travel log, showing numerous private flight entries and exits recorded by U.S. Customs and Border Protection.

events.title: Epstein travel from KBED to TIST
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein traveled from Laurence G. Hanscom Field (KBED) to Cyril E. King Airport (TIST) in the U.S. Virgin Islands via private aircraft N212JE.

events.title: Epstein travel to TFFJ
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein traveled from Teterboro (TIST) to TFFJ (Tortola, BVI) via private aircraft N331JE, with a customs inspection.

events.title: Epstein arrival with customs inspection
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein arrived at Palm Beach International (KPBI) from Teterboro (TIST) via private aircraft N120JE, undergoing a customs inspection.

events.title: Epstein's latest logged flight
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein's most recent flight entry in this log, traveling from an unknown location to Palm Beach International (KPBI) via private aircraft N212JE, with a customs inspection.

locations: West Palm Beach/Palm Beach International Airport (KPBI/PBI), Florida
Cyril E. King Airport (TIST), St. Thomas, U.S. Virgin Islands
Long Island MacArthur Airport (KISP), New York
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein maintained an extremely active private flight schedule, with 136 recorded entries in the CBP TECS system between December 2016 and December 2018.
Epstein used multiple private aircraft with tail numbers N212JE, N120JE, N415LM, N331JE, and N90JE for his travels.
Primary travel routes connected New York/New Jersey (Teterboro), Florida (Palm Beach, Fort Lauderdale), and the Caribbean (U.S. Virgin Islands, British Virgin Islands, Guadeloupe).
The logs show both domestic flights and international trips requiring customs inspections (coded A523, A511, etc.), indicating travel to and from foreign destinations.
This document was generated on January 4, 2019, by U.S. Customs and Border Protection, indicating law enforcement monitoring of Epstein's movements prior to his July 2019 arrest.
